content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Love to see interesting puzzle using brainfck

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's comparable to writing an interpreter for a very very small language; it's a bit more of a meaningful task than many other Clashes I see, and would be very fun to try in Shortest mode (particularly given BrainF*ck's typical history as being the language with a tiny compiler).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is interesting

I like the idea, but I feel like you should change it a bit so it is not directly Brainfuk. As people can easily search up an compiler for that and be done within seconds, it would be better to keep the same idea but make it a bit unique so it is not exactly the same, and people can't just copy it off the internet.
Done in 3 minutes, so there is time to golf it. I like it.

If the current version seems too easy or straightforward, it can be modified to require processing the [ and ] commands for conditional jumps. This would require the players also to count them in order to handle nested jumps.

Input section
* Please add the variable name [[programText]] between "single line" and "consisting".

* Please format ">", "<", "+" and "-" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* Please move the explanation of the 4 characters to Goal section.

* Please change "these Characters, each of which is a single command:" to "{{>}}, {{<}}, {{+}} and {{-}}".

Constraints section
* Please change "the Brainf*ck Program (the input String)" to [[programText]].

Goal section
* Maybe keep just the second example so that the statement won't be too long?

Thanks.

I've created a small HTML page that visualises the examples from this puzzle:
https://pastebin.com/FG1S7zJs
you should share it via code pen so people can actually see the webpage
The management of conditional jumps might be too complex for clashes but perfect for puzzles such as this one: https://www.codingame.com/training/medium/what-the-brainfuck

Please add back "length of" in front of [[programText]] in Constraints section.

Thanks again.
